justification: The Methods section states that participants "completed two personality instruments: the ACS-90 and the Interpersonal Reactivity Index (IRI)", identifying the IRI as the tool used to assess trait empathy.
Participants also completed "the Action Control Scale (ACS-90)", which is explicitly described as a personality instrument assessing action-control tendencies.

measured_by: Adapted Cox et al. reciprocity model applied to iterated Ultimatum Game behaviour
justification: The authors "applied our adapted reciprocity model to estimate the degree to which each player's choices reflected reciprocal reactions to their partner's prior behaviour", indicating this computational model serves as the measure of individual reciprocity.

measured_by: Behaviour in the Ultimatum Game (UG) and iterated Ultimatum Game (iUG)
justification: The introduction notes that "Responders' behaviour appears to reflect an aversion to inequity" and that the UG "presents a simple paradigm to investigate dyadic interaction", showing the game is used as the instrument for measuring fairness-related constructs.
